nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# LinkedIn Web Scraping with Bright Data MCP Server & Google Gemini

## Overview
Automated workflow: LinkedIn Web Scraping with Bright Data MCP Server & Google Gemini. This workflow integrates 13 different services: stickyNote, httpRequest, code, lmChatGoogleGemini, readWriteFile. It contains 27 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 27
- **Node Types**: 13
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **When clicking ‘Test workflow’**: manualTrigger
- **Sticky Note1**: stickyNote
- **Set the URLs**: set
- **Bright Data MCP Client For LinkedIn Person**: mcpClient
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- **List all tools for Bright Data**: mcpClient
- **Bright Data MCP Client For LinkedIn Company**: mcpClient
- **Set the LinkedIn Company URL**: set
- **Webhook for LinkedIn Company Web Scraper**: httpRequest
- **LinkedIn Data Extractor**: informationExtractor
- ... and 17 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
